p: Experiments were conducted with five replicates and ten replicates in vitro and in vivo, respectively. Data were subjected to one-way analysis of variance (ANOVA) with SPSS statistics 22 software. Tukey’s post hoc test was used when variances remained homogeneous (Levene’s test) and T3 Dunnett’s post hoc one was employed if not, assuming equal variances. Differences were considered to be significant at p ≤ 0.05.
